intro: Symonanthus bancroftii, commonly known as the Cape fumitory, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related genera. The plant is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Symonanthus bancroftii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
